contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=February 2013}} {{Orphan|date=February 2012}} {{Infobox person | name = Zainul Abideen<br />{{lang|ar|زين العابدين}} | image = Zainu noonu.jpg | background = non_performing_personnel | birth_name = | alias = Noonu | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1989|9|13}} | birth_place = [[Alleppey, India]] | occupation = Actor, Director, Scriptwriter, Visual Engineer | years_active = 2007–present | website = {{URL|http://twitter.com/#!/nOOnuz|Zainul Abideen Twitter}} }} '''Zainul Abideen''' ({{lang-ar|زين العابدين}}, {{lang-ml|സൈനുല്‍ ആബിദീന്‍}} ; born September 13, 1989 in [[Alleppey, India|Alleppey]], [[India]]) is a [[Muslim]] [[India]]n [[actor]], [[film director]], [[screenwriter]] and [[VFX creative director]]. His film ''[[Neenumolkku]]<ref name="Film Neenumolkku">[http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_detailpage&list=UUxLeOMBuOusrP_SFJ4vJtQQ&v=_EUw-11IF8s#t=8s Film on youtube]</ref> '', an internationally successful film with strong Muslim religious and social influences, was released in 2008. ==Career== Zainul Abideen and his family moved to [[Kodungallur]] when he was six years old. He completed his schooling there gaining a Bachelors degree in [[Saree'ath Islamiya|Islamic Jurisprudence]]. After university he entered the Multimedia industry in Kerala, When family moved to Calicut in 2008 Zainul Abideen followed soon after to continue his industry career in the Calicut producing for artists such as Rodhan Ashraf On a visit home to Alleppey he became engaged once more with his Islamic faith and decided to move away from a career as a scriptwriter of Short films with a strong Muslim religious influence. ===Breakthrough success and ''Neenumolkku''=== In January 2008, Zainul Abideen began working on a film with Bright Media released on November 2008 and released by V.K Ali chancellor of an Islamic university, Kerala. Zainul Abideen and Zaidhan Pictures successfully used new media such as [[Facebook]], [[YouTube]] to promote films. In June 2011, Zain released "Soulmates" a shortfilm inspired by a nightmare about his friend Rodhan Ashraf. In August 2011 he Posted as Lecturer in Multimedia in Al Jamia Al Islamiya, Santhapuram.
